reviewText:
First impressions. Always a little cautious about horror games. 1) Because I'm not a huge fan and 2) Seem to be a dime a dozen trying to cash-in on the craze. Can happily say thus far Vapour has surprised me a great deal. While it's not without it's flaws and I will get slaughtered for daring to even mention it. Had strong flashbacks to games like Hexen and Heretic during my playtime. Mostly because of the level design and puzzle integration rather then monsters.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UFZWoS9WByo
Gameplay is straight forward enough. You play the role of a psychotic warlock known as 'Charles' who is more the a little peeved off at being kept captive and tortured for the better part of eternity. Broken free from purgatory he now must make his way through the borders of hell in some vain attempt to reach earth, reclaim his life and seek revenge on those who sent him there in the first place. Plays out rather well and more story then expected, cursing is a little overused just for effect but it's not entirely out of place.

Gamepad didn't work by default but it's unity so controls could probably be rebound through the launcher, keyboard+mouse controls were great. Problems were the lack of in-game options since unfortunately mouse sensitivity was through the roof and I had to tone it down via dpi settings instead. FOV sliders would be a welcome addition as well. As someone who is prone to motion sickness thankfully was able to play without vomiting though felt screen space could use expanding.

If you enjoy horror or dark adventure games it's worth checking out. Just keep in mind it contains more then a few jump scares and it's not just about 'running and gunning' as the store page might suggest . Few minor bugs that should be addressed in patches as well. Devs have plans to add future (free) content so we'll see how that goes, as this is first impressions cannot say how much gametime Vapour currently contains. Cheers folks. :)

Likes:
Non-linear level design
Bioshock-esque magic system.
Puzzles that require some thought
Creative monsters

Dislikes:
Physics bugs
Load times could be improved.
Repeated jump scares (uses 1-3 effects so far)
No Achievements

NOTES:
Gametime isn't logged correctly since I play offline.
Developer provided a steam code. Never changes my thoughts.
voteText: 66 of 94 people (70%) found this review helpful 6 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Vapour isn't your normal horror game, it's a mix of old school elements such as Duke Nukem, Penumbra and a bit of DOOM as well.

Vapour starts you off as a vengeful fighter trying to eliminate those who have wronged him in his life, the ones who sent him to hell/purgatory and in this quest you discover new and interested features. The game itself when you first play it feels like DOOM slapped with a bit of Elder Scrolls with the magic abilities, although the game does feature a collection of horrifying and quite disturbing monsters, jump scares are also in this game and the devs make a good use of them as well.

Trying to understand this game might be difficult at first. There is no real helpful system in the beginning unless you ask a developer or someone who's played what to do. I had to ask the creator numerous times,  What do I do now? "
However later in the game it shows small clips of where your objectives are located. Though the game still does not easily map out the locations with a minimap or compass which would help with the navigation of the game which may be it's biggest fault.

PROS -

- Interesting atmosphere
- Unique concepts
- Challenging enemies
- Interactive story driven campaign
- Suspensful horror with a mix of amnesia type feeling.
- Dark and ominous music fit for this game.

CONS -

- No Minimap
date:
system of navigation.
- No real backstory of why you are in purgatory.
- Difficult and sometimes glitchy campaign


I'd have to give this game a rating of a 7.4/10 It's not a perfect game but it's a good one you should pick up. Hopefully the developers can add a minimap or navigation system soon to make the game a lot more enjoyable to everyone who has high hopes for it's future development."

reviewText: I really enjoyed my playthrough of Vapour, for someone who likes a challenge and loves old school games, this game is enjoyable. Most of the old school elements were there, flooding rooms, boulder runs, switch puzzles, as well as the old memory / tune puzzle (Much like Fallout 3's musical tune puzzle). The enemies are variable and quite a challenge to boot, my favorite battle was the first witch, while it might of been a glitch ,she spawned while the room was flooding forcing me to use the extra rooms to replenish my mana and health and then haveing to scamble to solve the puzzle before I drown after killing her, quite a challenge indeed. I loved the use of secret mana and health pick-ups, quite a nessecity to enable you to defeat some of those irratable wraiths. I was surprised when I reached the end of the game and could not reach the last room because some relics were off the path, a pleasant surprise to have to backtrack to find some secrets you missed. I quit this game twice, as in to the desktop and five minutes later found myself swearing and trudging through the puzzles again convinced that it was possible to beat that irratable wraith, even if he can drift through objects and screw you over almost instantly, if you have decided to replenish at the wrong time. Anyway I really liked the game and for a very small indie development team for their first game not a bad game at all, anyone who has the time, patients and persistence to finish this game will be rewarded with nestalgia of the old school games and when the gameplay made the game and not the story.Not to mention I played this game in one sitdown from 9pm - 5am, 8 hours of enjoyable and challenging fun.
voteText: 14 of 21 people (67%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
An excellent blend of horror and shooter games. The level design is one of my favorite things about this game, I ran around for quite some time trying to figure out where to go next. I would compare the level design to Duke Nukem 3D or Shadow Warrior (the old one).

Exploration and your memory will serve you well in this game. and you may have to try some difficult jumping, but don't give up you'll find the way eventually. Graphically the game looks great, it uses Unity 5 and has some really great texture work. The enemies all look very good and most are not just one hit kills.

On to a few gripes I have, Minimal UI can leave you guessing what items you have collected (keys and so on) and your health is (I believe) shown by the glowing color on your arm. I realize the developers wanted a minimal UI but there is also no real explanation of the elements on the screen. Hopefully this will be addressed in a future update or patch.

Overall I really recommend this game if you like Hexxen, Duke Nukem 3D, or Shadow Warrior. The Devs are really nice and are quick to answer any questions you might have and talk to you about any issues you may have running the game.

reviewText: It does not take much for me to find enjoyment from a gaming experience. Give me tools to kill an enemy, allow me to feel good about myself by completing a puzzle, or just tell me a captivating story and I will be a happy man. Vapour’s gameplay annoyed me to my breaking point. Not only was I unable to find enjoyment within the experience, but I had to force myself to keep playing for the purpose of writing this review. I’m not implying that the game is unplayable, because there gamers that enjoy intense challenges. If the challenging nature of the game was due to combat difficulty or lack of skill, I would have been content. Instead, I got up from my computer chair feeling worthless and uneducated.   Forcing players to progress the story with little assistance is one thing, but I felt like I was searching for needles in a field of haystacks.\n\nRead the full review here: http://www.steamfirst.com/vapour-part-1-review/

I was also really taken back by the amazing atmosphere created by the music and the sound, definitely going to spring for the Soundtrack soon as well.

Definitely give this game a go, especially now for Halloween season, great eerie atmosphere, nice variety in game design and puzzles and the length isnt bad for the price, hope that this dev can get the support they need to complete the series.

reviewText:
In short: Avoid it like the plague

The rest:
Most of my playtime with this game was spent wandering around aimlessly. I jumped almost all through the level until finding what I needed to find and all sorts of items start popping up in places I'd already been.

The three enemy types encountered either were annoying, flying heads or headspiders. Or somesort of hellknight that distorted my screen when hit and as it's attack. An attack which seemed to be a one hit kill after I hit the damn thing with between six or seven lightningbolts.

Bugs are a plenty in this mess, and janking up the scenery seems to be a substitute for gameplay. Think Skyrim but without the fun of watching a horse do it.  The screen was tearing all over the place even with Vsync up to max. For some reason the resoultion kept getting set down to 640x860 automatically in the ingame menu. I still have no way of knowing what resolution the game was actually running in. The launcher said one thing, ingame said another. When I set the Vsync on the graphics went from Fantastic to Beautiful, couldn't set it back.

reviewText:
WOW! What an amazing game! First of all if your a fan of the Build Engine games (especially Blood) then this game is for you, there is also a good measure of modern Horror mixed in. Not just Jump Scares but a very unsettling and creepy environment as well, not to mention the few areas that just make you plain nervous.

For those not familiar with the Build Engine games, if you like Action/Adventure FPS games that give you maze like non-linear level design with cool weapons, awesome enemies, some intense puzzles and bit of platforming then this game is for you.

The Horror aspect is also nice and strong, some good Jump Scares and a very eerie environment, dont even get me started on the Boss enemy, that thing is straight from HELL itself.

Another thing that I like is the nice clean approach the devs took for the HUD and showing Player Info (health, mana/ammo etc.) it really draws you into the game, dont want to spoil too much though, you need to play it yourself.

Extremely well done for a small Indie studio from South Africa and if this is their first commercial game I'm very interested to see what they do next.

PROS:

-Amazing level design that will have you exploring for hours.
-Puzzles are insane.
-Variety in game mechanics (Shooting/Fighting, Exploration, Puzzle Solving, Platforming).
-Really pretty and complex for an indie game.
-Unique representation of Player Info (Health, Mana/Ammo etc).
-Frightening Jump Scares and an eerie environment all round.
-Awesome enemy designs.
-Combat is nice and varied.
-Great attention to detail on the spells and the environment.


CONS:

-Well it is an Indie Game so I guess dont expect AAA, but as an Indie Game, these devs really created something special.
- Another possible con, It isnt everyone's cup of tea. It is one of those games where you might struggle to figure out where to go or what to do sometimes and some might see some of the deaths as a bit cheap, but in my opinion thats one of the things that makes it an awesome games, I really like a challenge and having to figure everything out so the sense of reward is amazing, additionally there are optional in-game hints that help quite a bit, for those that want them.
-Some people might find some of the scares too much of the Jumpy variety but I love Jump Scares, especially if they are done well and there are also a lot of other different types of scares in the game and a very creepy atmosphere throughout.

8.5/10

Not even done with Part 1 yet and I cant wait for Part 2, definitely going on my list of favourite indie games.

reviewText:
Rolling-boulder simulator, first thing the character does after intro is rolling around not sure if it suppose to happen. started feeling nauseous and ended up in bloody water and died multiply times as i could not move or do anything.
Lost interest in the game & trying to fix it.
The Intro-Story started good but was exaggerated towards the ending.

(edit: Dev comment and looks to be working hard for their game cant be better to give them a Recomendation afterall the game seems to be in well care and thats whats matters from Smaller studios)

reviewText:
Vapour indie game is okay with dark atmosphere and jumpscares...But there are no clues where to go,so you have to figure it out yourself pretty much with fuzzy objectives.

More monsters would have made this game better.(little repetitive for me)

When finishing the short game,I was pretty much like meh(?) about the ending.(But that's part1 for you)

Overall this is good game if you seek for creepy environment,
